description: From Middle English miskenninge, from Old English miscennung (“a mistake or variation in pleading before a court, a fine exacted for such a mistake”), equivalent to misken +‎ -ing or mis- +‎ kenning. Cognate with Dutch miskenning (“misunderstanding, mistreatment”).

examples: So that by about 1300, Dublin (b) or Waterford spoke with authority thus : "... it may be a cause of miskenning if perchance it happens that a man sues at the bar and the other party answers him, [...]
